Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E26 Old Tony Old Tony, an irritable old recluse, has a reputation in North Fork as being a mean hermit. When Mark and his girlfriend, Lorrie, look for arrowheads on his land, they become trapped in quicksand. Tony shows his good-hearted nature and rescues them.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E3 Cross Purpose Cheyenne finds himself involved in a dispute regarding dead war hero, Colonel Charles DeVier. Many believe the Comanches killed him, but the discovery of the hero's body and the disappearance of Captain Robert Holman leads Cheyenne to the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E4 The Young Fugitives Cheyenne visits old friend Frank Collins who is in a wheelchair. He sees that townspeople are taunting Frank's loner son, Gilby. Gilby enters a circus shooting contest in town. Tragedy ensues when Gilby shoots a man. Cheyenne must stop a lynch mob.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E9 Done Deal Bubba, Cody and Booger close their biggest cattle deal ever on The Cowboy Way! The million-dollar herd is ready to ship, but moving all that cattle into trucks becomes a race against the clock for their much-needed final paycheck. The cowboys help a woman remove cattle from her family’s land when she is forced to sell the property after the passing of her parents. Having been through a similar situation, Booger is inspired to fix-up his family’s old homestead as a special surprise for his grandma. Cody’s book is finally finished, but as Misty plans the book-signing event, a missed shipment could derail the whole party. The Cattlemen’s Association invites the guys to their annual ball, with a very special honor in store.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: It’s a special Christmas Episode of The Cowboy Way. The holidays are always hectic, but for cowboys it’s especially busy because it’s also calving season. Time for the birth of new baby calves to join the herd. Bubba, Cody, and Booger must monitor their heifers around the clock and still find time to shop for gifts, decorate for Christmas, and enjoy time with their families. Booger helps Matthew pick out an extra-special gift to top Grandma’s Christmas tree. Cody looks to buy Carter the perfect cute new puppy. Kaley enlists the wives to help prepare for the Thompson’s annual holiday party. But, when a heifer who’s in labor goes missing one night, the cowboys frantically search for her while trying to keep from missing the big event.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E33 Death Trap Lucas and Mark find a wounded man and bring him into North Fork to save his life. Lucas asks Simon Battle, a gunfighter-turned-doctor, to help the man. The wounded man's enemies have other plans in store.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E34 The Queue A Chinese man named Wang Chi and his son, Wang Lee, come to North Fork to open a laundry service in town. Vince Fergus, a prejudiced man, bullies them but Micah, Lucas, and Milly try to convince them to stay. A fight between Fergus and Lucas ensues.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Romance in the Wilds
programme.desc: Deep in the Rocky Mountains, lightning strikes a mining site, sparking a deadly wildfire and igniting an unexpected romance between a forest ranger and a geologist as they race to escape the flames.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E23 The Guest A charming man named Mario Rosati arrives at the McCain Ranch and introduces himself as an acquaintance of an old family friend. Lucas and Mark offer him a place to stay for a few days, but they learn that he has an ulterior motive: to kill Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E24 Old Man Running An old man named Sam Gibbs comes to North Fork in need of Marshal Micah Torrance's protection from criminals who are after him. Sam happens to be Mark's grandfather and Lucas' deceased wife's father. Lucas finds peace with his past and helps Sam.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E26 Old Tony Old Tony, an irritable old recluse, has a reputation in North Fork as being a mean hermit. When Mark and his girlfriend, Lorrie, look for arrowheads on his land, they become trapped in quicksand. Tony shows his good-hearted nature and rescues them.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E3 Cross Purpose Cheyenne finds himself involved in a dispute regarding dead war hero, Colonel Charles DeVier. Many believe the Comanches killed him, but the discovery of the hero's body and the disappearance of Captain Robert Holman leads Cheyenne to the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E4 The Young Fugitives Cheyenne visits old friend Frank Collins who is in a wheelchair. He sees that townspeople are taunting Frank's loner son, Gilby. Gilby enters a circus shooting contest in town. Tragedy ensues when Gilby shoots a man. Cheyenne must stop a lynch mob.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E1 Go Big or Go Broker Tough jobs and shady business deals force the cowboys to work smarter, not harder. A local rancher asks the guys to remove an ornery bull from his property, but this one is as bullheaded as they come—and takes longer than expected. Tired of scrapping for day wages, the cowboys decide to put their hard-earned experience to use: instead of working cattle for others, they’ll start brokering herds themselves. After sifting through his grandmother’s old photos, Booger reconnects with his past, then looks to the future by passing on “the cowboy way” to four-year-old Matthew. While Bubba confides in Kaley that the cowboys are reevaluating their business, Cody gets bad news about his upcoming rodeo, which is even worse news for his bank account.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E2 Don't Mess with Texas The cowboys head to Texas! A simple wrangling job leads to the perfect cattle trading opportunity. The guys plot a course for Texas to capitalize on a buyer’s market. Cody forgets his saddle on a routine roundup, and the only thing sorer than his backside is his ego when Booger and Bubba don’t let him live down his mistake. After months of searching, Jaclyn and Booger finally find a piece of land perfect for settling down. But can they pull the trigger on the property before someone else swoops in? Bubba gets in hot water with Kaley when he tells Andrew, a long-term friend and ranch hand, that he can crash at their place—but without asking her first. Still licking his wounds from a double-cross, Cody weighs the pros and cons of holding his own rodeo. As their wives juggle life back home, the cowboys hit the road to broker their first big deal. They hope to find the crossbred cattle their buyer is looking for in the Lone Star State.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Vaqueros Mexican bandits attack Lucas and Mark for crossing their desert without paying. The group steals their horses, kidnaps Mark, and leaves Lucas to die in the desert. Lucas gets free and trails the banditos to a small village.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E2 First Wages Against Lucas' wishes, Mark gets a job at the livery stable in town. Lucas has doubts that Mark can both work and get his chores done on time. Mark finds himself in trouble when he takes a shortcut on an errand and meets a dangerous bank robber.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E4 Eye of the Storme With only half of the contestants left, the competition intensifies when the cowboys realize their every move could lead to their elimination. A female competitor continues to make an impression on the contestants and judges. An individual medley race brings everyone’s competitive nature to the surface as some of them get creative to get ahead. In the end, a cowboy is awarded the immunity belt buckle for the second time. A contestant’s expertise as a cow boss is called into question during the team cattle weight challenge, leaving his reputation on the line. Two more cowboys hit the trail after a shocking elimination that no one saw coming.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E14 Annie Oakley: Rise of a Shooting Star After her father’s death, nine-year-old Annie Oakley first picks up a rifle and begins shooting small game in order to feed her siblings and support her widowed mother. By her teenage years, Annie is so good at hunting that she begins supplying meat to a local grocery store, earning enough money to pay off her mother’s mortgage. When famed sharpshooter Frank Butler comes to town for an exhibition, Annie accepts his challenge to participate in a shooting match. Not only does she win the match, but she wins Butler’s heart as well. They are soon married, but they struggle to make it as a team on stage. A better shooter, Annie must become the main attraction for them to succeed. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson, tracks down Annie’s husband to learn more about the rise of this shooting star.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie’s new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie’s talent that she doesn’t hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E1 John Colter: King of the Mountain Men As a member of Lewis and Clark's Corps of Discovery, John Colter travels from the Missouri River all the way to the Pacific Ocean, but he decides not to return to the civilized East when the expedition ends. Entranced by the beauty and adventure of the wild frontier, he becomes one of America's first mountain men. As a hunter, trapper and explorer in his own right, he's the first American to see the Grand Tetons and the epic Yellowstone Valley. While his epic explorations make him famous, it's a harrowing ordeal with Blackfeet warriors that makes him a legend. After boldly venturing into territory controlled by the Blackfeet tribe, Colter is captured, stripped naked, and forced to run for his life as warriors give chase in what will come to be known as Colter's Run.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E2 Jim Bridger: Forged on the Frontier With dreams of fortune and adventure, an 18-year-old Jim Bridger joins William Ashley's expedition to trap beaver along the Missouri River. But a grim ordeal soon forces Bridger to weigh his morals against the harsh reality of survival in the wild. A vicious grizzly bear attack leaves fellow trapper and hunter Hugh Glass on the verge of death and completely dependent upon Bridger's care. As a hostile band of Arikara warriors begins to close in, Bridger must choose between staying with the dying man and risking certain death, or leaving his injured comrade alone in the woods and fleeing to safety. In what becomes a legendary tale of the wild frontier, Bridger wrestles to choose between right and wrong, knowing the harsh retribution that will follow if he makes the wrong choice.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E12 Judgement Day Still feeling the effects of Hezekiah Horn's death, Cody seeks guidance from a self-proclaimed preacher named Gideon Poole. Cody discovers that Poole is a bounty hunter and that he is after Teaspoon for dropped charges from 16 years ago.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E5 Day's Pay Cheyenne arrives in a town held hostage by a gang of bandits. Outlaw Luis Boladas kills young, inexperienced Sheriff Billy Fipps. The town wants to lynch Boladas, but Cheyenne discovers he once saved him from hanging.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E6 Retaliation Sheriff Cheyenne Bodie is out of town visiting widow Cora Ainslie and her son Bart. A group of men robs the bank and blows up a train trestle while he is away. Cheyenne discovers that banker Thackery Smith rules the town, and many are not happy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E1 Go Big or Go Broker Tough jobs and shady business deals force the cowboys to work smarter, not harder. A local rancher asks the guys to remove an ornery bull from his property, but this one is as bullheaded as they come—and takes longer than expected. programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E5 Day's Pay Cheyenne arrives in a town held hostage by a gang of bandits. Outlaw Luis Boladas kills young, inexperienced Sheriff Billy Fipps. The town wants to lynch Boladas, but Cheyenne discovers he once saved him from hanging.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E6 Retaliation Sheriff Cheyenne Bodie is out of town visiting widow Cora Ainslie and her son Bart. A group of men robs the bank and blows up a train trestle while he is away. Cheyenne discovers that banker Thackery Smith rules the town, and many are not happy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: The cowboys are deep in the heart of Texas! In this episode of The Cowboy Way, the guys try to cash in on a cattle bounty roundup: hard cash for each cow they catch. But this money ain’t easy thanks to a sprawling 500-acre ranch covered in mesquite brush with razor-sharp thorns. Just when the cowboys think they’ve found a promising Texas cattle connection, Booger makes a big mistake that could jeopardize their first meeting with a hard-nosed rancher. Back in Alabama, Bubba and Kaley’s house guest is beginning to overstay his welcome. As they try to teach Andrew the Thompson house rules, he commits the biggest cowboy sin of all — messing with Bubba’s grill! Booger, Jaclyn, and Matthew care for a new-born calf. Misty has a special surprise for Cody. An offer to travel back to Texas for another cattle drive doesn’t thrill the cowboys, but they begin to consider the networking potential and how it might make their cattle-trading dreams come true.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E4 Cash Cows First, the cowboys need to track down one of Bubba’s most troublesome heifers before she can bust through his fence again. After briefly tending to business and family in Alabama, the guys head back to the Lone Star State to try and expand their network of contacts. Bubba, Cody, and Booger help their new friend Cash with a big Texas cattle drive in the hopes of both leading the herd to greener pastures and finding the big cattle deal they came west for. On the range they forge deeper bonds with their Texas counterparts, swapping cowboy stories around the campfire. But things take a turn for the worse when the herd overheats, and the creek they’re all counting on has run dry as a bone. Back home, Jaclyn and Matthew are learning to love life on the ranch. Houseguest Andrew’s disgusting habits have Kaley seeing red. And just as Misty gets back in the barrel-racing saddle, she starts to butt heads with her high-strung mare.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E3 Sheer Terror Lucas stands guard at the North Fork Bank when $50,000 arrives in a specially designed stagecoach strongbox. Two gunmem who plan to ambush and rob the stage take Milly and Mark hostage in the general store, which doubles as their headquarters.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E4 The Stand-In Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain Ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas refuses since they are taking a murderer named Rudy Croft to be hanged in Yuma. Later, Croft escapes and the guards take Lucas as their prisoner.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Big Boss Man With only four cowboys left, Trace raises the stakes by taking away the chance to win immunity from elimination. At this point, one mistake can cost any of them the competition. A series of challenges test the remaining contestants on their mastery of essential cowboy skills: horsemanship, roping, and cattle handling. One of the top competitors delivers less-than-perfect results for the first time and misses the mark during a steer-roping challenge. When tending to the cattle, two of the contestants’ lack of experience comes to light, putting the health of the herd at risk. One of the competitors uses his experience as a cow boss and takes control of the group challenge. The other cowboys question his direction, unsure if his tactics will be successful. Trace makes a tough decision and sends someone packing.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E8 Jedediah Smith: Scholar and Survivor A young Jedediah Smith joins William Ashley's expedition and helps establish the fur trade along the Missouri River, but it's not hunting or trapping he longs for...it's adventure. Inspired by Lewis and Clark, he wants to explore the vast, uncharted American frontier. Trekking through unknown and unforgiving terrain, Smith's iron will and unwavering courage under fire help him survive a vicious grizzly bear attack, hostile Native Americans, and life-or-death periods of starvation, dehydration, and exhaustion. During his incredible journeys, he becomes the first non-Native American to cross the Mojave Desert into California, the first to navigate through the perilous Sierra Nevada Mountains, and the first to traverse the Great Basin Desert. He ultimately sees more of the American West than any other adventurer, including Lewis and Clark, and opens the frontier in a way that no other mountain man can claim.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Trapper, Trader, Legend Although from humble beginnings, Tom Fitzpatrick is ambitious and intelligent. When he joins up with William Ashley's trapping expedition, he proves himself to be an invaluable member of the company, both as a hardy frontiersman and a shrewd businessman. Along with legendary mountain man Jedediah Smith, Fitzpatrick rediscovers the South Pass through the Rocky Mountains, opening the pathway that will enable western expansion for decades to come. Fitzpatrick quickly rises to the top of the fur trade and eventually takes over the company he once worked for, but he nearly loses everything when he takes a wrong turn while leading a supply train. Alone in the wilderness, he finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a band of Gros Ventre warriors. Somehow, Fitzpatrick must survive the harrowing trek back to safety without a horse, gun, or supplies.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Peacemakers Jimmy falls for Alice, who is a member of a religious group called The Peacemakers. Jimmy defends the members who want to settle and build a church. However, the hostile townspeople are against their plans to use the land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E7 Storm Center Cheyenne arrives in Devil's Gorge just in time for a bank robbery. After he kills one of the robbers, he becomes a hero. An orphan boy comes to Cheyenne hoping that he can help him find his parents. When the boy goes missing, Cheyenne must find him.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

But this money ain’t easy thanks to a sprawling 500-acre ranch covered in mesquite brush with razor-sharp thorns. Houseguest Andrew’s disgusting habits have Kaley seeing red. And just as Misty gets back in the barrel-racing saddle, she starts to butt heads with her high-strung mare.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E3 Sheer Terror Lucas stands guard at the North Fork Bank when $50,000 arrives in a specially designed stagecoach strongbox. Two gunmem who plan to ambush and rob the stage take Milly and Mark hostage in the general store, which doubles as their headquarters.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E4 The Stand-In Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain Ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas refuses since they are taking a murderer named Rudy Croft to be hanged in Yuma. Later, Croft escapes and the guards take Lucas as their prisoner.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Big Boss Man With only four cowboys left, Trace raises the stakes by taking away the chance to win immunity from elimination. At this point, one mistake can cost any of them the competition. A series of challenges test the remaining contestants on their mastery of essential cowboy skills: horsemanship, roping, and cattle handling. One of the top competitors delivers less-than-perfect results for the first time and misses the mark during a steer-roping challenge. When tending to the cattle, two of the contestants’ lack of experience comes to light, putting the health of the herd at risk. One of the competitors uses his experience as a cow boss and takes control of the group challenge. The other cowboys question his direction, unsure if his tactics will be successful. Trace makes a tough decision and sends someone packing.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E8 Jedediah Smith: Scholar and Survivor A young Jedediah Smith joins William Ashley's expedition and helps establish the fur trade along the Missouri River, but it's not hunting or trapping he longs for...it's adventure. Inspired by Lewis and Clark, he wants to explore the vast, uncharted American frontier. Trekking through unknown and unforgiving terrain, Smith's iron will and unwavering courage under fire help him survive a vicious grizzly bear attack, hostile Native Americans, and life-or-death periods of starvation, dehydration, and exhaustion. During his incredible journeys, he becomes the first non-Native American to cross the Mojave Desert into California, the first to navigate through the perilous Sierra Nevada Mountains, and the first to traverse the Great Basin Desert. He ultimately sees more of the American West than any other adventurer, including Lewis and Clark, and opens the frontier in a way that no other mountain man can claim.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Trapper, Trader, Legend Although from humble beginnings, Tom Fitzpatrick is ambitious and intelligent. When he joins up with William Ashley's trapping expedition, he proves himself to be an invaluable member of the company, both as a hardy frontiersman and a shrewd businessman. Along with legendary mountain man Jedediah Smith, Fitzpatrick rediscovers the South Pass through the Rocky Mountains, opening the pathway that will enable western expansion for decades to come. Fitzpatrick quickly rises to the top of the fur trade and eventually takes over the company he once worked for, but he nearly loses everything when he takes a wrong turn while leading a supply train. Alone in the wilderness, he finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a band of Gros Ventre warriors. Somehow, Fitzpatrick must survive the harrowing trek back to safety without a horse, gun, or supplies.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Peacemakers Jimmy falls for Alice, who is a member of a religious group called The Peacemakers. Jimmy defends the members who want to settle and build a church. However, the hostile townspeople are against their plans to use the land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E7 Storm Center Cheyenne arrives in Devil's Gorge just in time for a bank robbery. After he kills one of the robbers, he becomes a hero. An orphan boy comes to Cheyenne hoping that he can help him find his parents. When the boy goes missing, Cheyenne must find him.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E5 The Fall of Booger Bubba, Booger and Cody take an important step toward becoming big-time cattle brokers! The guys are roping and doctoring yearlings on the Texas range. But when Booger’s most reliable horse Studly trips, smashing both horse and rider to the ground, Booger must rush out to find a vet and tend to his injured horse. Just as the cowboys are about to leave Texas, a local rancher makes them an offer they can’t refuse. Will the guys gamble on a cattle deal, taking on a herd before they have a buyer lined up? Back home in Alabama, Kaley’s patience reaches a breaking point as houseguest Andrew tracks in mud and expects a free lunch. To top it off, he then asks if his whole family can crash there while he searches for a permanent residence. Misty finds some extra help with her troublesome barrel-racing horse. Booger and Matthew are on the hunt for the perfect one-year anniversary gift for Jaclyn. But Booger may have a special surprise up his sleeve.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E6 Storm's A-Brewin' A storm is coming to The Cowboy Way! Cody visits his cousin Bo to secure steer for his upcoming rodeo, leaving Booger and Bubba to ear-tag some yearlings by themselves. Bubba takes the opportunity to put houseguest Andrew to work. Misty continues to try and shake off her barrel-racing rust, and comes to a serious crossroads with her misbehaving mare. Jaclyn presses Booger to put a timeline on finding them a permanent home. Bubba sets out on a solo trip back to Texas to check out a lead on a big herd of Tigerstripe cattle. But just when he’s about to cross the state line, a devastating category 4 hurricane barrels down on Alabama. All the cowboys’ best-laid plans come to a screeching halt. Bubba must decide whether to turn around and head home, or push through for the big deal. Finding themselves directly in the path of the hurricane, everyone scrambles to prepare their ranches for the worst. Can the cowboys and their families safely ride out the storm?

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E5 The Journey Back Mark takes a job on new neighbor Will Temple's ranch but is taken back by Temple's badly scarred face. When a cavalry officer stops by the McCain Ranch looking for a deserter who committed murder, both Mark and Lucas question who Temple really is.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E6 The Decision While repairing a fence on his property, Lucas witnesses a murder. The killer, Corey Hazlett, is the son of a wealthy rancher named Frank Hazlett. When Lucas agrees to testify at Corey's trial, there are threats to harm Mark.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E6 End of the Trail The three remaining cowboys go head-to-head in a dramatic final showdown to prove they have more heart, grit, and cowboy skills than their fellow competitors. In the arena, the cowboys are tested individually on roping and reining. The extremely technical challenge puts the contestants on edge. An impressive performance by one of the competitors sets the bar high for the rest of the cowboys. Out in the field, the contestants have to work together as a team in their last challenge. The cowboys must successfully drive a herd through a grueling three-mile journey of pastures and pines, navigating multiple obstacles throughout the way. Feeling the pressure to win, bad communication puts the herd in a dangerous situation when a group of their cattle wanders onto a busy road. Trace spends one-on-one time with the remaining cowboys, evaluates their performances throughout the competition, and names the first-ever winner of the Ultimate Cowboy Showdown.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Texas Fence-Cutting War When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E3 Jim Beckwourth: War Chief of the Crow When former slave Jim Beckwourth heads west to seek work as a trapper, he begins what will become one of the most eventful, heroic lives of all the mountain men. As a joke, one of Beckwourth's fellow trappers tells a group of Crow warriors that Beckwourth is a long-lost member of their tribe, and the adventure begins. Adopted by the Crow, Beckwourth joins them in a series of ferocious battles with other tribes, becomes a war chief, and falls in love with a fierce female warrior named Pine Leaf. He then uses his hard-won influence with the Crow to convince them to provide furs to the powerful American Fur Company. But an unexpected visit from legendary trapper and old friend Tom Fitzpatrick sets off a violent collision that forces Beckwourth to choose between the two worlds he loves.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E26 Old Tony Old Tony, an irritable old recluse, has a reputation in North Fork as being a mean hermit. When Mark and his girlfriend, Lorrie, look for arrowheads on his land, they become trapped in quicksand. Tony shows his good-hearted nature and rescues them.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E3 Cross Purpose Cheyenne finds himself involved in a dispute regarding dead war hero, Colonel Charles DeVier. Many believe the Comanches killed him, but the discovery of the hero's body and the disappearance of Captain Robert Holman leads Cheyenne to the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E4 The Young Fugitives Cheyenne visits old friend Frank Collins who is in a wheelchair. He sees that townspeople are taunting Frank's loner son, Gilby. Gilby enters a circus shooting contest in town. Tragedy ensues when Gilby shoots a man. Cheyenne must stop a lynch mob.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E9 Done Deal Bubba, Cody and Booger close their biggest cattle deal ever on The Cowboy Way! The million-dollar herd is ready to ship, but moving all that cattle into trucks becomes a race against the clock for their much-needed final paycheck. The cowboys help a woman remove cattle from her family’s land when she is forced to sell the property after the passing of her parents. Having been through a similar situation, Booger is inspired to fix-up his family’s old homestead as a special surprise for his grandma. Cody’s book is finally finished, but as Misty plans the book-signing event, a missed shipment could derail the whole party. The Cattlemen’s Association invites the guys to their annual ball, with a very special honor in store.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: It’s a special Christmas Episode of The Cowboy Way. The holidays are always hectic, but for cowboys it’s especially busy because it’s also calving season. Time for the birth of new baby calves to join the herd. Bubba, Cody, and Booger must monitor their heifers around the clock and still find time to shop for gifts, decorate for Christmas, and enjoy time with their families. Booger helps Matthew pick out an extra-special gift to top Grandma’s Christmas tree. Cody looks to buy Carter the perfect cute new puppy. Kaley enlists the wives to help prepare for the Thompson’s annual holiday party. But, when a heifer who’s in labor goes missing one night, the cowboys frantically search for her while trying to keep from missing the big event.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E33 Death Trap Lucas and Mark find a wounded man and bring him into North Fork to save his life. Lucas asks Simon Battle, a gunfighter-turned-doctor, to help the man. The wounded man's enemies have other plans in store.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E34 The Queue A Chinese man named Wang Chi and his son, Wang Lee, come to North Fork to open a laundry service in town. Vince Fergus, a prejudiced man, bullies them but Micah, Lucas, and Milly try to convince them to stay. A fight between Fergus and Lucas ensues.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: Romance in the Wilds
programme.desc: Deep in the Rocky Mountains, lightning strikes a mining site, sparking a deadly wildfire and igniting an unexpected romance between a forest ranger and a geologist as they race to escape the flames.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E23 The Guest A charming man named Mario Rosati arrives at the McCain Ranch and introduces himself as an acquaintance of an old family friend. Lucas and Mark offer him a place to stay for a few days, but they learn that he has an ulterior motive: to kill Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E24 Old Man Running An old man named Sam Gibbs comes to North Fork in need of Marshal Micah Torrance's protection from criminals who are after him. Sam happens to be Mark's grandfather and Lucas' deceased wife's father. Lucas finds peace with his past and helps Sam.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E25 Which Way'd They Go? The Jackman clan must sell their farm to pay back taxes. The Jackmans were not much at farming so they move to a nearby town and take jobs as peace officers. When bank robbers confront them, Lucas must step in and help them deal with the outlaws.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E26 Old Tony Old Tony, an irritable old recluse, has a reputation in North Fork as being a mean hermit. When Mark and his girlfriend, Lorrie, look for arrowheads on his land, they become trapped in quicksand. Tony shows his good-hearted nature and rescues them.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E3 Cross Purpose Cheyenne finds himself involved in a dispute regarding dead war hero, Colonel Charles DeVier. Many believe the Comanches killed him, but the discovery of the hero's body and the disappearance of Captain Robert Holman leads Cheyenne to the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E4 The Young Fugitives Cheyenne visits old friend Frank Collins who is in a wheelchair. He sees that townspeople are taunting Frank's loner son, Gilby. Gilby enters a circus shooting contest in town. Tragedy ensues when Gilby shoots a man. Cheyenne must stop a lynch mob.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E1 Go Big or Go Broker Tough jobs and shady business deals force the cowboys to work smarter, not harder. A local rancher asks the guys to remove an ornery bull from his property, but this one is as bullheaded as they come—and takes longer than expected. Tired of scrapping for day wages, the cowboys decide to put their hard-earned experience to use: instead of working cattle for others, they’ll start brokering herds themselves. After sifting through his grandmother’s old photos, Booger reconnects with his past, then looks to the future by passing on “the cowboy way” to four-year-old Matthew. While Bubba confides in Kaley that the cowboys are reevaluating their business, Cody gets bad news about his upcoming rodeo, which is even worse news for his bank account.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E2 Don't Mess with Texas The cowboys head to Texas! A simple wrangling job leads to the perfect cattle trading opportunity. The guys plot a course for Texas to capitalize on a buyer’s market. Cody forgets his saddle on a routine roundup, and the only thing sorer than his backside is his ego when Booger and Bubba don’t let him live down his mistake. After months of searching, Jaclyn and Booger finally find a piece of land perfect for settling down. But can they pull the trigger on the property before someone else swoops in? Bubba gets in hot water with Kaley when he tells Andrew, a long-term friend and ranch hand, that he can crash at their place—but without asking her first. Still licking his wounds from a double-cross, Cody weighs the pros and cons of holding his own rodeo. As their wives juggle life back home, the cowboys hit the road to broker their first big deal. They hope to find the crossbred cattle their buyer is looking for in the Lone Star State.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Vaqueros Mexican bandits attack Lucas and Mark for crossing their desert without paying. The group steals their horses, kidnaps Mark, and leaves Lucas to die in the desert. Lucas gets free and trails the banditos to a small village.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E2 First Wages Against Lucas' wishes, Mark gets a job at the livery stable in town. Lucas has doubts that Mark can both work and get his chores done on time. Mark finds himself in trouble when he takes a shortcut on an errand and meets a dangerous bank robber.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E4 Eye of the Storme With only half of the contestants left, the competition intensifies when the cowboys realize their every move could lead to their elimination. A female competitor continues to make an impression on the contestants and judges. An individual medley race brings everyone’s competitive nature to the surface as some of them get creative to get ahead. In the end, a cowboy is awarded the immunity belt buckle for the second time. A contestant’s expertise as a cow boss is called into question during the team cattle weight challenge, leaving his reputation on the line. Two more cowboys hit the trail after a shocking elimination that no one saw coming.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E14 Annie Oakley: Rise of a Shooting Star After her father’s death, nine-year-old Annie Oakley first picks up a rifle and begins shooting small game in order to feed her siblings and support her widowed mother. By her teenage years, Annie is so good at hunting that she begins supplying meat to a local grocery store, earning enough money to pay off her mother’s mortgage. When famed sharpshooter Frank Butler comes to town for an exhibition, Annie accepts his challenge to participate in a shooting match. Not only does she win the match, but she wins Butler’s heart as well. They are soon married, but they struggle to make it as a team on stage. A better shooter, Annie must become the main attraction for them to succeed. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson, tracks down Annie’s husband to learn more about the rise of this shooting star.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie’s new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie’s talent that she doesn’t hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E1 John Colter: King of the Mountain Men As a member of Lewis and Clark's Corps of Discovery, John Colter travels from the Missouri River all the way to the Pacific Ocean, but he decides not to return to the civilized East when the expedition ends. Entranced by the beauty and adventure of the wild frontier, he becomes one of America's first mountain men. As a hunter, trapper and explorer in his own right, he's the first American to see the Grand Tetons and the epic Yellowstone Valley. While his epic explorations make him famous, it's a harrowing ordeal with Blackfeet warriors that makes him a legend. After boldly venturing into territory controlled by the Blackfeet tribe, Colter is captured, stripped naked, and forced to run for his life as warriors give chase in what will come to be known as Colter's Run.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E2 Jim Bridger: Forged on the Frontier With dreams of fortune and adventure, an 18-year-old Jim Bridger joins William Ashley's expedition to trap beaver along the Missouri River. But a grim ordeal soon forces Bridger to weigh his morals against the harsh reality of survival in the wild. A vicious grizzly bear attack leaves fellow trapper and hunter Hugh Glass on the verge of death and completely dependent upon Bridger's care. As a hostile band of Arikara warriors begins to close in, Bridger must choose between staying with the dying man and risking certain death, or leaving his injured comrade alone in the woods and fleeing to safety. In what becomes a legendary tale of the wild frontier, Bridger wrestles to choose between right and wrong, knowing the harsh retribution that will follow if he makes the wrong choice.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E12 Judgement Day Still feeling the effects of Hezekiah Horn's death, Cody seeks guidance from a self-proclaimed preacher named Gideon Poole. Cody discovers that Poole is a bounty hunter and that he is after Teaspoon for dropped charges from 16 years ago.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E5 Day's Pay Cheyenne arrives in a town held hostage by a gang of bandits. Outlaw Luis Boladas kills young, inexperienced Sheriff Billy Fipps. The town wants to lynch Boladas, but Cheyenne discovers he once saved him from hanging.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E6 Retaliation Sheriff Cheyenne Bodie is out of town visiting widow Cora Ainslie and her son Bart. A group of men robs the bank and blows up a train trestle while he is away. Cheyenne discovers that banker Thackery Smith rules the town, and many are not happy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E1 Go Big or Go Broker Tough jobs and shady business deals force the cowboys to work smarter, not harder. A local rancher asks the guys to remove an ornery bull from his property, but this one is as bullheaded as they come—and takes longer than expected. Tired of scrapping for day wages, the cowboys decide to put their hard-earned experience to use: instead of working cattle for others, they’ll start brokering herds themselves. After sifting through his grandmother’s old photos, Booger reconnects with his past, then looks to the future by passing on “the cowboy way” to four-year-old Matthew. While Bubba confides in Kaley that the cowboys are reevaluating their business, Cody gets bad news about his upcoming rodeo, which is even worse news for his bank account.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E2 Don't Mess with Texas The cowboys head to Texas! A simple wrangling job leads to the perfect cattle trading opportunity. The guys plot a course for Texas to capitalize on a buyer’s market. Cody forgets his saddle on a routine roundup, and the only thing sorer than his backside is his ego when Booger and Bubba don’t let him live down his mistake. After months of searching, Jaclyn and Booger finally find a piece of land perfect for settling down. But can they pull the trigger on the property before someone else swoops in? Bubba gets in hot water with Kaley when he tells Andrew, a long-term friend and ranch hand, that he can crash at their place—but without asking her first. Still licking his wounds from a double-cross, Cody weighs the pros and cons of holding his own rodeo. As their wives juggle life back home, the cowboys hit the road to broker their first big deal. They hope to find the crossbred cattle their buyer is looking for in the Lone Star State.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Vaqueros Mexican bandits attack Lucas and Mark for crossing their desert without paying. The group steals their horses, kidnaps Mark, and leaves Lucas to die in the desert. Lucas gets free and trails the banditos to a small village.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E2 First Wages Against Lucas' wishes, Mark gets a job at the livery stable in town. Lucas has doubts that Mark can both work and get his chores done on time. Mark finds himself in trouble when he takes a shortcut on an errand and meets a dangerous bank robber.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E4 Eye of the Storme With only half of the contestants left, the competition intensifies when the cowboys realize their every move could lead to their elimination. A female competitor continues to make an impression on the contestants and judges. An individual medley race brings everyone’s competitive nature to the surface as some of them get creative to get ahead. In the end, a cowboy is awarded the immunity belt buckle for the second time. A contestant’s expertise as a cow boss is called into question during the team cattle weight challenge, leaving his reputation on the line. Two more cowboys hit the trail after a shocking elimination that no one saw coming.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E14 Annie Oakley: Rise of a Shooting Star After her father’s death, nine-year-old Annie Oakley first picks up a rifle and begins shooting small game in order to feed her siblings and support her widowed mother. By her teenage years, Annie is so good at hunting that she begins supplying meat to a local grocery store, earning enough money to pay off her mother’s mortgage. When famed sharpshooter Frank Butler comes to town for an exhibition, Annie accepts his challenge to participate in a shooting match. Not only does she win the match, but she wins Butler’s heart as well. They are soon married, but they struggle to make it as a team on stage. A better shooter, Annie must become the main attraction for them to succeed. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson, tracks down Annie’s husband to learn more about the rise of this shooting star.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie’s new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie’s talent that she doesn’t hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E1 John Colter: King of the Mountain Men As a member of Lewis and Clark's Corps of Discovery, John Colter travels from the Missouri River all the way to the Pacific Ocean, but he decides not to return to the civilized East when the expedition ends. Entranced by the beauty and adventure of the wild frontier, he becomes one of America's first mountain men. As a hunter, trapper and explorer in his own right, he's the first American to see the Grand Tetons and the epic Yellowstone Valley. While his epic explorations make him famous, it's a harrowing ordeal with Blackfeet warriors that makes him a legend. After boldly venturing into territory controlled by the Blackfeet tribe, Colter is captured, stripped naked, and forced to run for his life as warriors give chase in what will come to be known as Colter's Run.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E2 Jim Bridger: Forged on the Frontier With dreams of fortune and adventure, an 18-year-old Jim Bridger joins William Ashley's expedition to trap beaver along the Missouri River. But a grim ordeal soon forces Bridger to weigh his morals against the harsh reality of survival in the wild. A vicious grizzly bear attack leaves fellow trapper and hunter Hugh Glass on the verge of death and completely dependent upon Bridger's care. As a hostile band of Arikara warriors begins to close in, Bridger must choose between staying with the dying man and risking certain death, or leaving his injured comrade alone in the woods and fleeing to safety. In what becomes a legendary tale of the wild frontier, Bridger wrestles to choose between right and wrong, knowing the harsh retribution that will follow if he makes the wrong choice.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E12 Judgement Day Still feeling the effects of Hezekiah Horn's death, Cody seeks guidance from a self-proclaimed preacher named Gideon Poole. Cody discovers that Poole is a bounty hunter and that he is after Teaspoon for dropped charges from 16 years ago.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E5 Day's Pay Cheyenne arrives in a town held hostage by a gang of bandits. Outlaw Luis Boladas kills young, inexperienced Sheriff Billy Fipps. The town wants to lynch Boladas, but Cheyenne discovers he once saved him from hanging.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E6 Retaliation Sheriff Cheyenne Bodie is out of town visiting widow Cora Ainslie and her son Bart. A group of men robs the bank and blows up a train trestle while he is away. Cheyenne discovers that banker Thackery Smith rules the town, and many are not happy.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: The cowboys are deep in the heart of Texas! In this episode of The Cowboy Way, the guys try to cash in on a cattle bounty roundup: hard cash for each cow they catch. But this money ain’t easy thanks to a sprawling 500-acre ranch covered in mesquite brush with razor-sharp thorns. Just when the cowboys think they’ve found a promising Texas cattle connection, Booger makes a big mistake that could jeopardize their first meeting with a hard-nosed rancher. Back in Alabama, Bubba and Kaley’s house guest is beginning to overstay his welcome. As they try to teach Andrew the Thompson house rules, he commits the biggest cowboy sin of all — messing with Bubba’s grill! Booger, Jaclyn, and Matthew care for a new-born calf. Misty has a special surprise for Cody. An offer to travel back to Texas for another cattle drive doesn’t thrill the cowboys, but they begin to consider the networking potential and how it might make their cattle-trading dreams come true.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E4 Cash Cows First, the cowboys need to track down one of Bubba’s most troublesome heifers before she can bust through his fence again. After briefly tending to business and family in Alabama, the guys head back to the Lone Star State to try and expand their network of contacts. Bubba, Cody, and Booger help their new friend Cash with a big Texas cattle drive in the hopes of both leading the herd to greener pastures and finding the big cattle deal they came west for. On the range they forge deeper bonds with their Texas counterparts, swapping cowboy stories around the campfire. But things take a turn for the worse when the herd overheats, and the creek they’re all counting on has run dry as a bone. Back home, Jaclyn and Matthew are learning to love life on the ranch. Houseguest Andrew’s disgusting habits have Kaley seeing red. And just as Misty gets back in the barrel-racing saddle, she starts to butt heads with her high-strung mare.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E3 Sheer Terror Lucas stands guard at the North Fork Bank when $50,000 arrives in a specially designed stagecoach strongbox. Two gunmem who plan to ambush and rob the stage take Milly and Mark hostage in the general store, which doubles as their headquarters.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E4 The Stand-In Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain Ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas refuses since they are taking a murderer named Rudy Croft to be hanged in Yuma. Later, Croft escapes and the guards take Lucas as their prisoner.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Big Boss Man With only four cowboys left, Trace raises the stakes by taking away the chance to win immunity from elimination. At this point, one mistake can cost any of them the competition. A series of challenges test the remaining contestants on their mastery of essential cowboy skills: horsemanship, roping, and cattle handling. One of the top competitors delivers less-than-perfect results for the first time and misses the mark during a steer-roping challenge. When tending to the cattle, two of the contestants’ lack of experience comes to light, putting the health of the herd at risk. One of the competitors uses his experience as a cow boss and takes control of the group challenge. The other cowboys question his direction, unsure if his tactics will be successful. Trace makes a tough decision and sends someone packing.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E8 Jedediah Smith: Scholar and Survivor A young Jedediah Smith joins William Ashley's expedition and helps establish the fur trade along the Missouri River, but it's not hunting or trapping he longs for...it's adventure. Inspired by Lewis and Clark, he wants to explore the vast, uncharted American frontier. Trekking through unknown and unforgiving terrain, Smith's iron will and unwavering courage under fire help him survive a vicious grizzly bear attack, hostile Native Americans, and life-or-death periods of starvation, dehydration, and exhaustion. During his incredible journeys, he becomes the first non-Native American to cross the Mojave Desert into California, the first to navigate through the perilous Sierra Nevada Mountains, and the first to traverse the Great Basin Desert. He ultimately sees more of the American West than any other adventurer, including Lewis and Clark, and opens the frontier in a way that no other mountain man can claim.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E6 Tom Fitzpatrick: Trapper, Trader, Legend Although from humble beginnings, Tom Fitzpatrick is ambitious and intelligent. When he joins up with William Ashley's trapping expedition, he proves himself to be an invaluable member of the company, both as a hardy frontiersman and a shrewd businessman. Along with legendary mountain man Jedediah Smith, Fitzpatrick rediscovers the South Pass through the Rocky Mountains, opening the pathway that will enable western expansion for decades to come. Fitzpatrick quickly rises to the top of the fur trade and eventually takes over the company he once worked for, but he nearly loses everything when he takes a wrong turn while leading a supply train. Alone in the wilderness, he finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with a band of Gros Ventre warriors. Somehow, Fitzpatrick must survive the harrowing trek back to safety without a horse, gun, or supplies.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Peacemakers Jimmy falls for Alice, who is a member of a religious group called The Peacemakers. Jimmy defends the members who want to settle and build a church. However, the hostile townspeople are against their plans to use the land.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E7 Storm Center Cheyenne arrives in Devil's Gorge just in time for a bank robbery. After he kills one of the robbers, he becomes a hero. An orphan boy comes to Cheyenne hoping that he can help him find his parents. When the boy goes missing, Cheyenne must find him.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

But this money ain’t easy thanks to a sprawling 500-acre ranch covered in mesquite brush with razor-sharp thorns. programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E7 Storm Center Cheyenne arrives in Devil's Gorge just in time for a bank robbery. After he kills one of the robbers, he becomes a hero. An orphan boy comes to Cheyenne hoping that he can help him find his parents. When the boy goes missing, Cheyenne must find him.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E5 The Fall of Booger Bubba, Booger and Cody take an important step toward becoming big-time cattle brokers! The guys are roping and doctoring yearlings on the Texas range. But when Booger’s most reliable horse Studly trips, smashing both horse and rider to the ground, Booger must rush out to find a vet and tend to his injured horse. Just as the cowboys are about to leave Texas, a local rancher makes them an offer they can’t refuse. Will the guys gamble on a cattle deal, taking on a herd before they have a buyer lined up? Back home in Alabama, Kaley’s patience reaches a breaking point as houseguest Andrew tracks in mud and expects a free lunch. To top it off, he then asks if his whole family can crash there while he searches for a permanent residence. Misty finds some extra help with her troublesome barrel-racing horse. Booger and Matthew are on the hunt for the perfect one-year anniversary gift for Jaclyn. But Booger may have a special surprise up his sleeve.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E6 Storm's A-Brewin' A storm is coming to The Cowboy Way! Cody visits his cousin Bo to secure steer for his upcoming rodeo, leaving Booger and Bubba to ear-tag some yearlings by themselves. Bubba takes the opportunity to put houseguest Andrew to work. Misty continues to try and shake off her barrel-racing rust, and comes to a serious crossroads with her misbehaving mare. Jaclyn presses Booger to put a timeline on finding them a permanent home. Bubba sets out on a solo trip back to Texas to check out a lead on a big herd of Tigerstripe cattle. But just when he’s about to cross the state line, a devastating category 4 hurricane barrels down on Alabama. All the cowboys’ best-laid plans come to a screeching halt. Bubba must decide whether to turn around and head home, or push through for the big deal. Finding themselves directly in the path of the hurricane, everyone scrambles to prepare their ranches for the worst. Can the cowboys and their families safely ride out the storm?

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E5 The Journey Back Mark takes a job on new neighbor Will Temple's ranch but is taken back by Temple's badly scarred face. When a cavalry officer stops by the McCain Ranch looking for a deserter who committed murder, both Mark and Lucas question who Temple really is.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E6 The Decision While repairing a fence on his property, Lucas witnesses a murder. The killer, Corey Hazlett, is the son of a wealthy rancher named Frank Hazlett. When Lucas agrees to testify at Corey's trial, there are threats to harm Mark.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E6 End of the Trail The three remaining cowboys go head-to-head in a dramatic final showdown to prove they have more heart, grit, and cowboy skills than their fellow competitors. In the arena, the cowboys are tested individually on roping and reining. The extremely technical challenge puts the contestants on edge. An impressive performance by one of the competitors sets the bar high for the rest of the cowboys. Out in the field, the contestants have to work together as a team in their last challenge. The cowboys must successfully drive a herd through a grueling three-mile journey of pastures and pines, navigating multiple obstacles throughout the way. Feeling the pressure to win, bad communication puts the herd in a dangerous situation when a group of their cattle wanders onto a busy road. Trace spends one-on-one time with the remaining cowboys, evaluates their performances throughout the competition, and names the first-ever winner of the Ultimate Cowboy Showdown.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E4 The Legend of Nat Love When Black cowboy Nat Love overnights in Deadwood during a cattle drive, he decides to enter a Fourth of July cowboy competition. Confident in his roping, riding, and shooting skills, he is eager to test his mettle against the best cowboys around.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E2 The Texas Fence-Cutting War When homesteaders keep cutting down her fences to access grazing land and water, a widowed landowner teams up with famed Texas Ranger Ira Aten to protect her property. Aten hopes his explosive plan of action will force the cutters to compromise.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E3 Jim Beckwourth: War Chief of the Crow When former slave Jim Beckwourth heads west to seek work as a trapper, he begins what will become one of the most eventful, heroic lives of all the mountain men. As a joke, one of Beckwourth's fellow trappers tells a group of Crow warriors that Beckwourth is a long-lost member of their tribe, and the adventure begins. Adopted by the Crow, Beckwourth joins them in a series of ferocious battles with other tribes, becomes a war chief, and falls in love with a fierce female warrior named Pine Leaf. He then uses his hard-won influence with the Crow to convince them to provide furs to the powerful American Fur Company. But an unexpected visit from legendary trapper and old friend Tom Fitzpatrick sets off a violent collision that forces Beckwourth to choose between the two worlds he loves.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E5 Kit Carson: The Greatest Scout in the West As a fur trapper, hunter, scout, and explorer, Kit Carson is an irresistible subject for reporters and novelists, and his incredible adventures make him a mythic figure in his own lifetime. Yet fame is the last thing on Carson's mind in 1849. All he wants to do is settle down to a quiet life with his wife on the family ranch, but once again fate comes calling. When settler Ann White is captured by an Apache raiding party, the Army seeks out Carson to help track the warriors and rescue Mrs. White, whose husband was killed in the raid. Although known to be the best tracker in the history of the Western Frontier, Carson admits this is the most difficult trail he has ever followed. He leads the military on a desperate chase, tracking the Apache through 200 miles of treacherous western wilderness. When they finally catch up with the Apache, the aftermath leaves Carson haunted for the rest of his days.
